title: Fire it up: TBM 930 engine start & beta range taxiing
description:
Master the TBM 930 in Microsoft Flight Simulator (MSFS) as we Fire it Up! This TBM 930 tutorial covers the Pratt & Whitney PT6 engine start sequence, "Cold and Dark" procedures, and taxiing techniques for beginners. Welcome to Part 3 of our series! We‚Äôre diving deep into this high-performance turboprop to show you exactly how to wake the beast without causing a "hot start."
In this episode, we break down the essentials: performing a proper Pre-Start Flow, managing the ITT (Interstage Turbine Temperature) during ignition, and mastering the Art of Beta for smooth taxiing. We‚Äôre also getting hands-on with the overhead panel, fuel systems, and engine indication systems (EIS) to ensure your aircraft is healthy and ready for the runway.

Stay tuned until the end for a "nice-to-know" pro tip regarding the Inertial Separator!

üìñ Chapters
In this video, we cover:

00:00 - TBM 930: The sound of silence 
01:07 - Pre-Start Flow: Setting the stage 
04:51 - Engine Start Sequence: managing the heat 
10:28 - After-Start cleanup & systems Check 
08:15 - TBM 930 Nice-to-Know Fact: Inertial Separator 
15:17 - Taxiing: The Art of Beta Range 
23:27 - Line-Up: the final configuration
27:08 - Takeoff: 850 horsepower unleashed
30:20 - Conclusion & week 4 Teaser

üì∑ Quick camera views
- shift 1: primary flight display (PFD)
- shift 2: multi function display (MFD)
- shift 3: autopilot controls
- shift 4: overview of PFD, MFD, autopilot controls, A/C, de ice system, landing gear,  pressurization and hot air flow
- shift 5: throttle, trim, flap controls and fuel selector
- shift 6: external/internal lights, electric power, engine start, fuel, ap/trims, ELT and oxygen controls
- shift 7: similar like the previous option but including the panel emer
- shift 8: power plugs
- shift 9: left door
- shift 0: passenger door

üí¨ Question of the day: Have you ever experienced a "Hot Start" in a turboprop? Let me know your close calls below!
